verses.roman:
sarva-sad-guṇa-pūrṇāṁ tāṁ
vande phālguna-pūrṇimām
yasyāṁ śrī-kṛṣṇa-caitanyo
'vatīrṇaḥ kṛṣṇa-nāmabhiḥ

synonyms: sarva—all; sat—auspicious; guṇa—qualities; pūrṇām—filled with; tām—that; vande—I offer obeisances; phālguna—of the month of Phālguna; pūrṇimām—the full-moon evening; yasyām—in which; śrī-kṛṣṇa-caitanyaḥ—Lord Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu; avatīrṇaḥ—advented; kṛṣṇa—Lord Kṛṣṇa's; nāmabhiḥ—with the chanting of the holy names.
translation: I offer my respectful obeisances unto the full-moon evening in the month of Phālguna, an auspicious time full of auspicious symptoms, when Lord Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu advented Himself with the chanting of the holy name, Hare Kṛṣṇa.
